Robin "Roblimo" Miller (October 30, 1952 – May 24, 2018) was an American journalist specializing in technology. He worked for Open Source Technology Group, the company that owned Slashdot, SourceForge.net, freshmeat, Linux.com, NewsForge, and ThinkGeek from 2000 to 2008. He was born in Elkridge, Maryland.
Miller had been a judge for the Lulu Blooker Prize and was on the online advisory board of the "Online Journalism Review" of the Annenberg Center for Communication at the University of Southern California.
Miller died at his home in Bradenton, Florida on May 24, 2018 of a heart attack at the age of 65.
